desc: North Korean forces cross the 38th parallel, starting the Korean War.
The 'Peanuts' comic strip by Charles M. Schulz is first published.
The first episode of 'I Love Lucy' premieres on CBS.
Julius and Ethel Rosenberg are sentenced to death for espionage.
Dwight D. Eisenhower is elected President in a landslide.
The first 'Walk' and 'Don't Walk' signs are installed in New York City.
Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II in London.
The first issue of Playboy magazine is published.
Brown v. Board of Education: Supreme Court outlaws school segregation.
The first nuclear-powered submarine, the USS Nautilus, is launched.
Disneyland opens in Anaheim, California.
The Salk polio vaccine is declared safe and effective.
Elvis Presley appears on The Ed Sullivan Show for the first time.
The Suez Crisis begins as Israel invades the Sinai Peninsula.
The USSR launches Sputnik 1, the first artificial satellite.
The Treaty of Rome is signed, establishing the European Economic Community.
NASA is created by the signing of the National Aeronautics and Space Act.
Chevrolet introduces the El Camino.
Alaska is admitted as the 49th U.S. State.
The Twilight Zone premieres on CBS.
John F. Kennedy defeats Richard Nixon in the presidential election.
The FDA approves the first birth control pill for commercial use.
Construction begins on the Berlin Wall.
The Bay of Pigs invasion of Cuba begins.
John Glenn becomes the first American to orbit the Earth.
Telstar, the first communications satellite, is launched.
President John F. Kennedy is assassinated in Dallas.
Valentina Tereshkova becomes the first woman in space.
The Beatles perform on The Ed Sullivan Show.
President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Civil Rights Act of 1964.
The Voting Rights Act is signed into law.
Operation Rolling Thunder begins its bombing campaign in Vietnam.
The first episode of 'Star Trek' premieres on NBC.
Miranda v. Arizona: Supreme Court establishes the Miranda Rights.
The first Super Bowl is played in Los Angeles.
Thurgood Marshall is sworn in as the first Black Supreme Court Justice.
Martin Luther King Jr. is assassinated in Memphis.
The Tet Offensive begins during the Vietnam War.
Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin walk on the Moon.
The first message is sent over ARPANET, the precursor to the Internet.
The first Earth Day is celebrated.
The 26th Amendment is ratified, lowering the voting age to 18.
The Watergate break-in occurs.
Paris Peace Accords are signed, ending U.S. involvement in Vietnam.
Richard Nixon announces his resignation as President.
Microsoft is founded by Bill Gates and Paul Allen.
United States Bicentennial celebration.
Elvis Presley dies at Graceland.
Karol Wojty≈Ça is elected Pope John Paul II.
The Iran Hostage Crisis begins.
John Lennon is shot and killed in New York City.
MTV (Music Television) launches.
The first commercial CD player is released in Japan.
Reagan proposes the Strategic Defense Initiative ('Star Wars').
Apple releases the first Macintosh computer.
The wreck of the RMS Titanic is discovered.
Chernobyl nuclear disaster occurs in the USSR.
The INF Treaty is signed by Reagan and Gorbachev.
Pan Am Flight 103 explosion over Lockerbie.
The Berlin Wall is opened.
